member.summary: Instantiates a new instance of a structure that is initialized with values.
member.param: Size of the buffer in bytes.
A combination of values that are combined by using a bitwise OR operation. The resulting value identifies how the buffer will be bound to the pipeline.
A -typed value that identifies how the buffer is expected to be read from and written to. Frequency of update is a key factor.
A combination of values that are combined by using a bitwise OR operation or 0 if no CPU access is necessary. The resulting value identifies CPU access.
A combination of values that are combined by using a bitwise OR operation or 0 if unused. The resulting value identifies miscellaneous buffer info.

param.name: structureByteStride
param.para: The size of each element in the buffer structure (in bytes) when the buffer represents a structured buffer. For more info about structured buffers, see Structured Buffer.

The size value in structureByteStride must match the size of the format that you use for views of the buffer. For example, if you use a shader resource view (SRV) to read a buffer in a pixel shader, the SRV format size must match the size value in structureByteStride.
